About Adding Files to Projects

You can add existing files, directories, or entire directory trees to a project database or project. When you add files to a project, Serena ChangeMan Version Manager creates new archives for the files and checks them in as the initial (1.0) revisions.

Default Options

Version Manager uses the following initial defaults when you add files or directories to a project:

  • Uses the revision description of "Initial Revision" when the workfiles are checked in. To modify the revision description, select the revision 1.0 from the Revision pane and modify the description.
  • Copies the workfiles from the selected directory to the project's workfile location.
  • Displays a message and does not add the versioned file if a versioned file with the same name already exists.
  • Adds the files in subdirectories if you are adding a directory that has subdirectories.
  • Keeps a read-only copy of the workfile.
  • Does not keep the revision locked after adding the file.
  • Does not assign a version label or create a branch.

You can override these defaults when adding workfiles.

Note about projects and folders: You can add individual files or a directory of files to projects and folders. When adding a directory of files, Version Manager adds the files located only at the root level of the directory; it does not add files located in subdirectories and it does not create projects or folders.

If you have installed Tracker TrackerLink or TeamTrack SourceBridge, Version Manager lets you associate issues with the files you add.
